Academic Excellence with Practical Competencies

A definitive guide to how we teach, assess, and support every learner from foundation to junior secondary.

Teaching and Learning Philosophy

We use learner-centered CBC strategies that prioritize conceptual understanding, critical thinking, communication, collaboration, and faith-based character formation.

  • Daily lesson design aligned to competency outcomes.
  • Continuous formative assessment and individual feedback.
  • Project-based learning tied to real-life challenges.
  • Strong parent engagement on learner growth goals.

Learning That Feels Relevant

Lessons connect classroom concepts to daily life, community needs, and future career interests.

Academic Levels and Core Curriculum

Each stage has clearly defined curriculum outcomes and support structures.

Pre-Primary (PP1-PP2)

Early literacy, numeracy, communication, and social-emotional development.

  • Language and reading readiness
  • Numeracy foundations
  • Creative play, art, and movement
  • Faith and values development

Primary (Grade 1-6)

Competency building in languages, mathematics, sciences, and social learning.

  • English, Kiswahili, Mathematics
  • Science and Technology
  • Social Studies and CRE
  • Creative Arts, PE, and Agriculture

Junior Secondary (Grade 7-9)

Advanced competency application, leadership, and pathway exploration.

  • Integrated science and technical studies
  • Humanities and communication skills
  • Digital literacy and project innovation
  • Career awareness and mentoring

Signature Programs and Learning Support

Targeted programs ensure each learner is challenged, supported, and inspired.

STEM Lab

Hands-on science experiments, coding basics, and innovation challenges.

Literacy Initiative

Guided reading blocks, writing clinics, and intervention support for fluency growth.

Arts Integration

Music, visual arts, and drama integrated into curriculum and performance projects.

Learning Support

Targeted support plans for diverse learning needs through teacher-family collaboration.

Sample Junior Secondary Timetable (Weekday)

TimeActivity
7:30 AM - 8:00 AMMorning prep and devotion
8:00 AM - 10:00 AMCore lessons (Math, Languages)
10:00 AM - 10:30 AMHealth break
10:30 AM - 1:00 PMScience, Humanities, Projects
1:00 PM - 2:00 PMLunch and mentorship
2:00 PM - 4:00 PMClubs, sports, and practical sessions

Our academic office and admissions desk can advise on level placement, transfer onboarding, and support pathways.
